title: Add an emotional personal note popup in the Closing section

requirements.text:
Add a new, highly-emotional personal note shown via a decorated pop-up in the last Closing section of the Rose Day page.

- In the Closing section ("#closing"), add a prominent button (e.g., "One more thing, Ira…") that opens a modal/pop-up.
- The pop-up must be visually decorated in the existing Rose Day theme (rose/pink/cream), including a decorative frame/background image.
- The pop-up content must include an emotional line addressed to Ira (English). Use this exact line as the main sentence:
  "Ira baby, please never leave me — I can’t live without you. You are my whole world."
- The pop-up must be dismissible via a close button and by pressing Escape, and should trap focus while open (accessible modal behavior).

quotes: I want this in last closing with a beautiful decorated pop up
Can you add a line in this website like something ver very emotional like Ira bby never ever leave me I can’t live without you u are my world something like that

acceptanceCriteria: In the Closing section, a clearly labeled button opens a modal/pop-up without navigating away from the page.
The modal displays the specified emotional line exactly as written.
The modal has a decorated romantic look consistent with the existing site theme and includes a decorative image frame/background.
Keyboard accessibility works: focus moves into the modal on open, stays trapped inside while open, closes on Escape, and returns focus to the trigger button on close.

requirements.text:
Extend the content model to support the new Closing-section personal note pop-up for both content variants (classic and emotional), and render the correct variant-specific pop-up copy based on the existing `?variant=` selection.

- Update `frontend/src/content/roseDayContent.ts` so `closing` includes fields for the pop-up trigger label and the pop-up body text.
- Provide suitable English copy for both variants; the emotional variant must use the exact emotional line specified in REQ-11.

quotes: Want to add a small personal note for Ira to make it even more emotional
I want this in last closing with a beautiful decorated pop up

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/content/roseDayContent.ts` defines pop-up content under the `closing` section for both `classic` and `emotional` variants.
Switching `?variant=classic` vs `?variant=emotional` changes the pop-up copy accordingly.
Default behavior (no `variant` param) continues to use the emotional variant and shows the emotional pop-up copy.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: `frontend/src/components/ui` and the Internet Identity/actor hooks listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Do not add new backend logic; backend/main.mo should remain unchanged unless strictly required for this UI-only feature.
Keep the pop-up styling consistent with the existing Rose Day palette (reds/pinks/cream/soft neutrals) and avoid blue/purple as primary colors.
nonGoals: Adding new pages, routing, or a multi-step flow beyond the Closing pop-up.
Adding any new authentication or backend persistence for the note content.
Replacing the existing Love Note reveal interaction; this change is only for an additional Closing pop-up.

required: Ornate rose-themed frame/background for a modal (rose-popup-frame.dim_1200x800.png)
